text: The C&C; 50 is a Canadian sailboat, that was designed by C&C; Design and first built in 1972. ==Production== The design was built by C&C; Yachts in Canada between 1972 and 1975, but it is now out of production. ==Design== The C&C; 50 is a small recreational keelboat, built predominantly of fiberglass, with wood trim. It has a masthead sloop rig, an internally-mounted spade-type rudder and a fixed fin keel. It displaces and carries of ballast. The boat has a draft of with the standard keel fitted. The boat is fitted with a Westerbeke 4-107 diesel engine of . The design has a PHRF racing average handicap of 51 with a high of 33 and low of 72. It has a hull speed of . ==See also== *List of sailing boat types Similar sailboats *Hunter 49 *Hunter HC 50 *Marlow-Hunter 47 *Marlow-Hunter 50 *Marlow-Hunter 50 Center Cockpit ==References== Category:Keelboats Category:1970s sailboat type designs Category:Sailing yachts
title: C&C 50
